intro: Rubus menkei var. scalarothyrsus, commonly known as the red-flowered bramble, is a shrub native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
